intro: Trichochloa implicata, commonly known as the woolly grass. It is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage, which gives it its common name. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. Trichochloa implicata typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
